Debug Measure

Source: R/MeasureDebug.R
mlr_measures_debug.Rd

This measure returns the number of observations in the Prediction object. Its main purpose is debugging.

Dictionary

This Measure can be instantiated via the dictionary mlr_measures or with the associated sugar function msr():

mlr_measures$get("debug")
msr("debug")

Meta Information

  • Type: NA

  • Range: \([0, \infty)\)

  • Minimize: NA

  • Required prediction: 'response'

See also

Dictionary of Measures: mlr_measures

as.data.table(mlr_measures) for a complete table of all (also dynamically created) Measure implementations.

Other Measure: MeasureClassif, MeasureRegr, Measure, mlr_measures_classif.costs, mlr_measures_elapsed_time, mlr_measures_oob_error, mlr_measures_selected_features, mlr_measures

Super class

mlr3::Measure -> MeasureDebug

Public fields

na_ratio

(numeric(1))
Ratio of scores which randomly should be NA, between 0 (default) and 1. Default is 0.

Method clone()

Usage

MeasureDebug$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Examples

task = tsk("wine")
learner = lrn("classif.featureless")
measure = msr("debug")
rr = resample(task, learner, rsmp("cv", folds = 3))
#> INFO  [12:18:45.992] Applying learner 'classif.featureless' on task 'wine' (iter 1/3) 
#> INFO  [12:18:46.002] Applying learner 'classif.featureless' on task 'wine' (iter 2/3) 
#> INFO  [12:18:46.013] Applying learner 'classif.featureless' on task 'wine' (iter 3/3) 
rr$score(measure)
#>             task task_id                     learner          learner_id
#> 1: <TaskClassif>    wine <LearnerClassifFeatureless> classif.featureless
#> 2: <TaskClassif>    wine <LearnerClassifFeatureless> classif.featureless
#> 3: <TaskClassif>    wine <LearnerClassifFeatureless> classif.featureless
#>        resampling resampling_id iteration prediction debug
#> 1: <ResamplingCV>            cv         1     <list>    60
#> 2: <ResamplingCV>            cv         2     <list>    59
#> 3: <ResamplingCV>            cv         3     <list>    59
